examples: he is alone in the field of microbiology
this theory is altogether alone in its penetration of the problem
Bach was unique in his handling of counterpoint
a breakdown of law unparalleled in our history

definitions.text: (followed by `to') applying exclusively to a given category or condition or locality
the single one of its kind
examples: the unique existing example of Donne's handwriting
a unique copy of an ancient manuscript
certain types of problems have unique solutions

definitions.text: highly unusual or rare but not the single instance
examples: had unique ability in raising funds
